SIEGE.Definition: a military operation in which enemy forces surround a town or building

FOR SAKE OF EASE.Definition: to make it simpler or easier

STRATEGIC.Definition: of great importance, usually regarding military operations

FALCON.Definition: a wild bird of prey with pointed wings and a long tail

TENTACLES.Definition: long flexible limbs of animals, used here to show the reach of influence and control

STRETCHED.Definition: reached as far as possible in a particular direction

THRONE.Definition: the usually impressive chair used by kings and queens

FLEET.Definition: the ships in a country's navy

OUTPOST.Definition: a military camp or position far from the main army

HARBOUR.Definition: an area of water next to the coast where ships can stay safe

INTENTIONS.Definition: things someone wants and plans to do

SHREWD.Definition: clever, with a good judgement of things

OARS.Definition: long poles used for moving a boat

TAKERS.Definition: people who take possession of something by capturing

GALLEY.Definition: a kind of ship used in The Middle Ages

ROWING.Definition: moving a boat by using oars

FATE.Definition: the outcome of a situation of which there is no control

CHARACTERISED.Definition: having as a typical quality or feature

CLIFFS.Definition: a high area of rock with a steep side

PENINSULA.Definition: a piece of land almost surrounded by water

BAYS.Definition: parts of the sea surrounded by land on three sides, natural harbours

ASHORE.Definition: towards the land coming from the sea

OUTNUMBERED.Definition: if you are outnumbered, you have fewer of something than someone else

BAY.Definition: a part of the sea surrounded by land on three sides, a natural harbour

SLAUGHTERED.Definition: killed in a cruel way and in large numbers

CANNON.Definition: a large gun shooting metal balls

CANNONBALLS.Definition: round metal balls fired from a cannon

PRESUMABLY.Definition: saying something depending on what one knows without being sure about it

WAIT IT OUT.Definition: wait until a hard period is over

DEFENCES.Definition: means and method of defending an area

NERVOUSLY.Definition: in a worried and anxious manner

REINFORCEMENTS.Definition: extra forces sent to increase the size of an army

OVERHEAR.Definition: hear something without meaning to and without intention

REINFORCEMENT.Definition: extra forces sent to increase the size of an army

STRONGHOLD.Definition: a position that is strongly defended

PRIDE.Definition: a feeling of confidence and satisfaction coming from some personal success or from some specific location

UNDERESTIMATE.Definition: think of something as worse than it is

SIEGES.Definition: military operations in which enemy forces surround a town or building

ARCHIPELAGO.Definition: an area of sea in which there are many small islands

SOUVENIR.Definition: a thing kept as a reminder of a place

STRATEGY.Definition: the art of planning a course of action during a war

PSYCHE.Definition: the mind, feelings, beliefs and way of life of a group
